skill.name: ASCIIColors Rich UI Components
skill.description: Building beautiful terminal interfaces using Panels, Tables, Trees, and Markdown rendering.
skill.content:
Master the complete suite of Rich-compatible terminal UI components provided by `ascii_colors`. This includes panels, tables, trees, syntax highlighting, markdown, and live dynamic updates.
```python from ascii_colors import ASCIIColors, rich import time
# 1. STRUCTURAL COMPONENTS (Panels & Tables) # Panels highlight text with titles and customizable borders ASCIIColors.panel( "Application initialization complete.", title="System Status", border_style="green", box="round" # square, round, double, minimal )
# Tables display structured data rows ASCIIColors.table( "Feature", "Status", "Version", rows=[ ["Colors", "[green]Enabled[/green]", "1.0.0"], ["Logging", "[yellow]Warning[/yellow]", "1.2.0"], ["UI", "[blue]Rich[/blue]", "2.0.0"] ], title="Library Metrics" )
# 2. HIERARCHY & FORMATTING (Trees, Syntax, Markdown) # Trees for file structures or recursive data root = ASCIIColors.tree("ðŸ“ project", style="bold blue") root.add_node("ðŸ“ src").add("ðŸ“„ main.py") root.add("ðŸ“„ README.md") rich.print(root)
# Syntax highlighting for code snippets code = "def start(): print('Engine On')" ASCIIColors.syntax(code, language="python")
# Markdown rendering for formatted strings ASCIIColors.markdown("# Title\n- Item **Bold**\n- Item *Italic*")
# 3. DYNAMIC UI (Spinners & Live Updates) # Status spinners for blocking I/O tasks with ASCIIColors.status("Downloading...", spinner="dots") as status: time.sleep(1) status.update("Extracting...") time.sleep(1)
# Live displays for updating any UI element in-place with ASCIIColors.live("[bold cyan]Generating Report...[/bold cyan]") as live: for i in range(1, 6): time.sleep(0.5) live.update(f"Step {i}/5: [blue]{'â–ˆ' * i}[/blue]") live.update("[bold green]âœ“ Done![/bold green]")
# 4. UTILITIES # Rules (Horizontal separators) ASCIIColors.rule("Config Section", align="center", style="yellow") # Columns layout ASCIIColors.columns("Left Panel", "Right Panel", equal=True)
